Job Title: Financial Analyst, Products & Technology

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
CCC Intelligent Solutions is a leading technology company helping to improve the insurance claims process for millions of people. Our award-winning SaaS platform connects more than 35,000 businesses, including insurance carriers, repair facilities, automakers, part suppliers, lenders, and others to streamline the process from start to finish.

Our advanced capabilities in AI, IoT, telematics, data, and analytics drive continual innovation across our platform, as we work to advance the multi-trillion-dollar P&C insurance economy’s digital transformation.

At CCC, our mission is to keep people’s lives moving forward when it matters most. Diversity of experience and perspective is key to our pursuit so we can deliver a future of possibilities for our customers.

The RoleThe Financial Analyst, Products & Technology (P&T) will provide timely, accurate and relevant financial information to senior leadership and departmental management by effectively turning financial data into insightful and actionable business intelligence. You will be deeply involved in the strategy and operations of our P&T organization.

Key  Responsibilities:

Work with leadership to validate trends and incorporate updated assumptions into the detailed monthly ForecastProvide financial data for P&T as part of the monthly close cyclePerform variance and root cause analysis of monthly results vs. prior year, budget and forecast, as well as month by month trends, etc.Develop efficient and effective operating reports on key drivers of business performanceAnalyze financial data, draw conclusions, and present recommendations to support business decisionsCreate and maintain financial modelsPrepare materials for Operations Review and Board Meetings, working with leadershipAssist in the identification and implementation of process and system improvements

Requirements:

B.S. in Business preferred (e.g., Finance, Accounting)CPA or MBA a plus, but not required2-3 years of relevant corporate finance / FP&A experienceUnderstanding of accounting principles and financial theoryExperience with monthly, quarterly and annual close processesExperience with financial modeling and ad hoc analysisStrong Microsoft Office skills, most notably ExcelExperience with Workday HCM/Financials and/or Essbase highly desiredExperience with Power BI a plusStrong interpersonal and written communication skills

About the company’s commitment to its employees:

CCC Intelligent Solutions employees are part of an inclusive culture that brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Our team is defined by our values of: Integrity, Customer-Focus, Innovation, Diversity & Inclusion, and Tenacity. Together, we help our clients and each other achieve new goals.

CCC is committed to providing employees with opportunities to advance their careers and skillsets. CCC team members receive access to training and education reimbursement is available.

CCC offers competitive compensation and generous benefits. Health insurance, PTO, 401K, are just some of the benefits available to team members.

Each team member plays an important role in the company’s success and each team member has a voice. CCC employee engagement and job satisfaction ratings consistently exceed industry norms – underscoring the value CCC places on its employees.

Explore the Employee Experience at CCC.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
